page.title: 16The bird life of llangybi
page.content: Llangybi Bottom is an important area in Gwent for birds.In Summer Yellow Wagtails,Skylarks and Lapwings nest on the open fields.Curlews are present each spring and probably breed. Kingfishers and Common sand pipers nest along the river bank and there is a small Sandmartin colony.Kestrals, Buzzards and Sparrowhawks breed locally and are often seen hunting over the area.Cuckoos occur annually and often lay their eggs in Dunnocks nests.Little owls nest in stunted old oaks and thurshes tits and warblers nest along the hedgerows. In Spring and Autumn the Bottoms are an ideal place to observe migration and often produce the earliest spring arrival dates of birds like Swifts,Swallows and house Martins,Redstarts+spotted flycatchers.Flooding provides excellent feeding for wildfowl+waders.
